alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 8:45PM MST until January 22 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph in the higher terrain. * WHERE...Pinehurst, Fourth Of July Pass, Osburn, Lookout Pass, St. Maries, Kellogg, Mullan, Wallace, Fernwood, and Dobson Pass. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times on and near Lookout Pass. Sudden reductions in visibility are possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
